title: Moment a Brazilian singer is forced to stop her show after losing her balance and falling backwards
text:
A Brazilian singer was forced to stop her show after losing her balance and crashing backwards onto the stage during a violent head-banging session.

Gaby Amarantos, 41, saw stars after fiercely shaking her head in time with the music in front of a roaring crowd at the Lambateria festival in Pará, Brazil.

Ms Amarantos, who sings a form of music from northern Brazil called tecnobrega, posted footage of her fall on Instagram and said she needed stitches to a head wound but was now back at home.

Footage of the incident shows the singer, wearing a purple bodysuit with puffed sleeves, waving her long ponytail around as she stamps her feet.

Suddenly, she stumbles backwards towards the floor, hitting her head on the DJs table as she falls.

Onlookers quickly scramble to help her, but she gets onto her knees and starts singing again.

Someone is then said to have come on stage to escort her away, although she said she finished the song before going to hospital.

She captioned the post: 'Darlings, I've been discharged from hospital and am now back home.

'The vibe of the festival was so great I decided to keep singing till the end.

Onlookers quickly scramble to help her, but she quickly gets onto her knees and starts singing again

'Even with a bust head I performed one of the most beautiful shows of my career with the crowd raving and singing. It was madness.

'I didn't realise how serious it was at first. I had several stitches.'

One fan replied: 'I've never seen anyone get up so quickly after such an impact.'

Another said: 'I'm so glad you're okay. I was really worried.'
description: Gaby Amarantos, 41, was performing at the Lambateria festival in Pará, Brazil. In video footage she posted to Instagram, she appears to get onto her knees and continue singing.
